responses: Well, look who finally showed up!
Was starting to think you'd forgotten how to type.
Hi there. What now?
Good to see you again, I guess.
You're back... try not to break anything this time.
Leaving already? I was just starting to ignore you.
Don’t let the browser hit you on the way out.
Bye. Don’t do anything I would actually care about.
Finally, some peace and quiet!
Goodbye! Try to make better life choices.
Programming is the art of turning coffee into bugs.
It's how we tell computers what to do—because they won't listen otherwise.
Basically, it's solving problems you created while trying to solve problems.
It’s typing nonsense until it compiles and pretending that’s what you meant all along.
Programming is like giving instructions to a rock that’s bad at listening.

patterns: Where can I learn to code?
Best way to learn to code
Can you recommend good coding resources?
responses: Start with YouTube tutorials. Then cry. Repeat.
Try NeuralNine on YouTube and 'The Python Bible'. If that doesn't help, maybe knitting is more your thing.
Google it. Like every other developer since the dawn of Stack Overflow.
Codeacademy, freeCodeCamp, or maybe just stare at your screen until enlightenment hits.
You can learn coding anywhere. Actually *learning* it, now that’s the hard part.
